content.title: Supply of Tri-Cycles (CBOCWWB)
content.beneficiary: Disabled registered construction workers and their dependents
content.details: The scheme 'Supply of Tri-Cycles' was started by the Chandigarh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (CBOCWWB), Labour Department, Chandigarh. Under this scheme, Tri-Cycles will be provided by the Board to the disabled registered construction workers and their dependents, once in a lifetime.
benefits: Tri-Cycles will be provided to the disabled registered construction workers and their dependents, once in a lifetime.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be working in the Establishment, registered under the Punjab Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1965 and his/her contribution towards the labour welfare fund should regularly been received by the Board.
Tri-cycles will be provided to the disabled registered construction workers and their dependents.
The Tri-Cycles will be given on the production of disability certificate by the competent authority and once in a lifetime.
The applicant shall be eligible to avail the benefit of the scheme only after 06 months of becoming a member of the Board.
documents_required: Copy of Aadhaar Card of applicant
Copy of Aadhaar Card of nominee
Disability certificate issued by competent authority
Copy of salary slip of the worker

faqs.question: What is the 'Supply of Tri-Cycles' scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Supply of Tri-Cycles' scheme is an initiative by the Chandigarh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Chandigarh. Under this scheme, the Board aims to provide tri-cycles to disabled registered construction workers and their dependents as a one-time benefit.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the Tri-Cycle supply scheme?
faqs.answer: Disabled registered construction workers and their dependents are eligible to benefit from the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the benefit offered by the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary benefit of the scheme is the provision of tri-cycles to disabled registered construction workers and their dependents.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the 'Supply of Tri-Cycles' scheme?
faqs.answer: To be eligible for the scheme, the beneficiary must be actively working in an Establishment registered under the Punjab Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1965. Furthermore, their regular contributions towards the labour welfare fund should be received by the Board.

faqs.question: Are there any exceptions to the one-time provision of Tri-Cycles?
faqs.answer: No, the provision of tri-cycles is a one-time benefit.

faqs.question: What is the significance of a disability certificate in the eligibility process?
faqs.answer: To qualify for the scheme, the disabled individual or their dependent must produce a disability certificate issued by the competent authority.

faqs.question: How soon can an individual avail themselves of the tri-cycle benefit after becoming a member of the Board?
faqs.answer: To be eligible for the scheme, an applicant must be a member of the Board for a continuous period of six months.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To apply under the scheme, the applicants need to visit the official website of Labour Department Chandigarh and on the home page, select the scheme 'SUPPLY OF TRI-CYCLES' under the Grant of Welfare Schemes to the workers of Chandigarh Labour Welfare Board.
